intro: Solanum bipatens, commonly known as the two-lobed nightshade, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of about 1 to 2 meters, characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and showy, violet to purple flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that are toxic to humans and animals. Its botanical features include hairy stems and flowers with five lobed petals, which are typical of the Solanaceae family. Solanum bipatens is often found in moist, shaded areas in the understory of tropical forests.
